N Teeth M Missing

N Teeth M Missing contains any model's intial values you add. Model initial values define the initial values for the corresponding inports of model(s) in a system definition file.

What do you want to do?

Set the tooth configuration for this profile

To set the tooth configuration for this profile, modify the controls on the page below. The image at the right of the configuration controls displays how the configuration is interpreted. The line at the top represents top dead center.

To specify the number of teeth in the profile, modify the Number of Teeth control. To specify the duty cycle of the teeth, high pulse and corresponding low pulse, modify the Tooth/Gap Duty Cycle control. To specify what part of tooth is located at top dead center, modify the TDC Configuration control. This allows specification of whether the beginning or middle of a tooth or gap is located at top dead center.

To specify the number of teeth missing, modify the Number of Missing Teeth control. To specify the location of those missing teeth, modify the Location of Missing Teeth control. Valid entries for the location of missing teeth include numbers in the range from 0 to 360 if you're using Crank Angle as the simulation angle reference and 0 to 720 if you're using Cycle Angle as simulation angle reference.

FPGA Simulation Angle Reference must be selected to match to the angle reference that is being used inside your bitfile for your N teeth M missing loop.

For more information about adding and configuring custom devices, refer to the Configuring and Running a Project book of the NI VeriStand Help, available by selecting Help»Search the NI VeriStand Help.
